comments:
I'm using 2.1M4 to develop plugins for 2.0.2.  When I set my Application
Location to my 2.0.2 installation, any runtime workbench launch using a fresh
workspace works fine, but subsequent launches indicate a boot URL pointing to
the 2.1M4 boot.jar and terminate with an InvocationTargetException.

First run:
-----------------------------------
Startup: unable to load configuration
java.io.FileNotFoundException: W:\eclipse\.config\platform.cfg (The system
cannot find the path specified)
Boot URL:
    file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot_2.0.2.1/boot.jar
Workspace location:
   w:\eclipse\runtime-workspace
Debug-Options:
    file:D:/eclipse/.options
Install URL:
    file:W:/eclipse/


Later runs:
-----------------------------------
Startup: using configuration
file:w:\eclipse\runtime-workspace\.metadata\.config\platform.cfg
Boot URL: file:/D:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot_2.1.0/boot.jar
Workspace location:
   w:\eclipse\runtime-workspace
Debug-Options:
    file:D:/eclipse/.options
Install URL:
    file:W:/eclipse/


.log:
------------------------------------
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 04, 2003 16:13:52.895
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching
org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.locateDefaultPlugins(PlatformConfiguration.java:2254)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.<init>(PlatformConfiguration.java:903)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.startup(PlatformConfiguration.java:1368)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.initialize(InternalBootLoader.java:582)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:989)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:838)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	... 7 more

This problem is gone in >= M5.
However if, for some reason, you want to keep using M4, there is a workaround.
In the runtime workbench configuration, go the "Program Arguments" text field, 
and append:
-boot url, where url for the boot.jar in your 2.0.2 install (e.g. -boot 
file:D:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot_2.0.2/boot.jar)
Resolving since we fixed the problem and there is a workaround for M4.

causedBy.message: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin.
